title: Peaceful Holiday Retreat
review: Sattal Christian Ashram is a peaceful holiday retreat tucked away in isolation,amidst sattal's dense forests.It is also a religious place.The best thing about this place is that welcomes people of all religions and casts.It is a perfect vacation spot.

title: Peaceful
review: This is one of the place that many would not visit when in Nainital. But its a lovely place to spend some peaceful time. Its worth a visit.

title: Paradise on earth
review: The peace & tranquility of this religious place is beyond imagination,  The Hills , the fresh water lake, the woods, the narrow lanes, the sounds of birds & animals, fresh thin air which is suppose to have healing properties all around makes this place a true  paradise on earth.

title: Peace
review: Close to the buzzing Sattal lake is Sattal Christian Ashram.

title: Good Getaway
review: This place and the surrounding lakes, and the tourist spots are good places to visit for getaways. Nested in Nature.

title: Very peaceful
review: I appreciate the management of ashram. Very peaceful and people are coperative. I will advise the visiters to visit this ashram at least one time in life and felt very peacefull.

title: Calmness
review: We visited the Church which is set amidst the forests & surrounded by mountains. It looked pretty with its diminutive size, stone architecture and the calmness it exuded. When we visited around noon, a service was in session.

title: Ashram
review: Sattal Christian ashram is the oldest ashram builtt on hills was founded by Dr. Stanley Jones in1930 and was a founding stone of SAT-TAL Ashram range.

title: Perfect for Summer Getaways!!
review: The Sattal Christian ashram is a beautiful property built in the 1930’s!!

title: Quaint hermitage
review: A long walk takes you to the early 20th century ashram. The buildings still speak of the colonial past.

title: Awesome
review: here i am writing about Sattal where this Ashram is located.  Here are seven lakes. ultimate beauty. i would suggest the readers to have a boat ride of atleast one hour to enjoy the natural beauty. If one has a time there are excellent resorts at Sattal - KMVN Rest House, Country Inn Resorts and V Resorts.

title: quiet, Christ-centered, tasteful octagonal chapel
review: I liked the design of the chapel.  The dining hall uses steel plates like something out of Oliver Twist.  The administration building is OK.  But I got the impression of too much self-satisfaction.  Also that it would be a dull place to stay most of the year--insufficient number of progressive people to help move research along, and that's why I'd go to a place--to study.

title: Wonderful place to find peace and tranquility
review: I have been going to this Ashram for almost 20 years now, this is a very good place to clear your mind and spend time in meditation. For people from the west I would really recommend the summer Ashram and to spend time with the guru, dr John. He is a real spiritual mentor and you will learn so much about faith from him.

title: Serene, beautiful, quiet, peaceful place
review: Staying at the Ashram, even just for a few days, was a breath of fresh air for my family, literally as well as figuratively! We had to keep asking ourselves if we were still in India, or had we snuck away onto a plane at night, as we have never heard anything in India as quiet and noise-pollution free in our 3 years here!

title: The best
review: Awesome is the word for sattal, it is one of the best location in and around that area, much better than Nainital.

title: ashram in nainital
review: The Sattal Christian Ashram is set amid a forest of oaks and pines on the banks of the jade green Garur Tal. The ashram was founded in 1930 by E. Stanley Jones, and is the “mother” of the International Christian Ashram movement. Primarily a silent retreat, the ashram has dormitories for guests. To get to Garur Tal, follow a curving wooded trail from the main lakes area. It’s a lovely walk through thick woods.

title: Amazing lakes and food
review: The rapelling and boating were excellent though the rapelling was at a very low height over the lake ( presumably because they want to give you a brief dunk in the lake to wet your feet. The food at the local dhaba is very  very good --served hot. Delicacies are Kari Chawal, Daal and believe it or not Baingan Bharta. The rajma was just OK. The rotis nice hot and fluffy.

title: Divine
review: The ashram has been setup in 1930 provides divine and peaceful environment, fresh breeze and picturesque scenery. The place is good for those who want to spend time outside the noise and hustle bustle of the city.

title: so beautiful
review: the ashram is one of the most beautiful and calming place in the whole city of nainital. the ashram has many beautiful lakes . Though you are not allowed to swim in them, you can enjoy the scenic beauty in a boat ride. It was a very lovely experience for me.

title: Peaceful and divine place
review: The place is funded by Dr E Stanley Jones in 1884 and from this place this is reached to whole world. Very beautiful and peaceful place. The Ashram for the people finding peace. Must visit place if you are going to Nainital.
